title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Submit issue Issues page

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: considering pull request, may want open issue first discuss maintainer(s).

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Fork repo GitHub account Clone version account machine account, e.g,. git clone https://github.com/<yourgithubusername>/rdatacite.git Make sure track progress upstream (.e., version rdatacite ropensci/rdatacite) git remote add upstream https://github.com/ropensci/rdatacite.git. making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes (bonus points making changes new feature branch - see https://guides.github.com/introduction/flow/ contribute branching, making changes, submitting pull request) Push account Submit pull request home base (likely master branch, check make sure) ropensci/rdatacite

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Check discussion forum think issue requires longer form discussion.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Chamberlain S (2024). rdatacite: Client 'DataCite' API. R package version 0.5.4,  https://github.com/ropensci/rdatacite, https://docs.ropensci.org/rdatacite/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rdatacite: Client for the 'DataCite' API},   author = {Scott Chamberlain},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.5.4,  https://github.com/ropensci/rdatacite},   url = {https://docs.ropensci.org/rdatacite/}, }

title: Client for the DataCite API
text: rdatacite provides programmatic accesses DataCite (https://datacite.org/) metadata REST API. Docs: https://support.datacite.org/docs/api https://support.datacite.org/reference rdatacite docs: https://docs.ropensci.org/rdatacite Package API: dc_providers dc_reports dc_check dc_events dc_dois dc_clients dc_client_prefixes dc_provider_prefixes dc_status dc_prefixes dc_activities

title: Client for the DataCite API
text: Stable CRAN version Development version github
code: install.packages("rdatacite") pak::pkg_install("ropensci/rdatacite") library('rdatacite')

title: Client for the DataCite API
text: Outputs nearly rdatacite functions class dc, S3 class ’s simply named list results. can easily remove class via unclass(). print.dc method prints data.frame data, included, reports slots exist, hides meta named list. can get metadata indexing like $meta.

title: Client for the DataCite API
text: may want start dc_dois(). query parameter supports Elasticearch query string queries. examples:
code: dc_dois(query = "climate change") #> datacite: dois #> found: 85075, pages: 400, page: 1 #> slots: data, meta, links #> $data #> # A tibble: 25 x 4 #>    id    type  attributes$doi $identifiers $creators $titles $publisher #>    <chr> <chr> <chr>          <list>       <list>    <list>  <chr>      #>  1 10.1… dois  10.15786/20.5… <list [0]>   <df[,6] … <df[,1… Mountain … #>  2 10.2… dois  10.25675/1021… <list [0]>   <df[,3] … <df[,2… Mountain … #>  3 10.2… dois  10.25675/1021… <list [0]>   <df[,3] … <df[,2… Mountain … #>  4 10.2… dois  10.25675/1021… <list [0]>   <df[,3] … <df[,2… Mountain … #>  5 10.2… dois  10.25675/1021… <list [0]>   <df[,3] … <df[,2… Mountain … #>  6 10.2… dois  10.25676/1112… <list [0]>   <df[,6] … <df[,1… Mountain … #>  7 10.2… dois  10.25676/1112… <list [0]>   <df[,6] … <df[,1… Mountain … #>  8 10.2… dois  10.25675/1021… <list [0]>   <df[,6] … <df[,2… Mountain … #>  9 10.2… dois  10.25675/1021… <list [0]>   <df[,6] … <df[,1… Mountain … #> 10 10.2… dois  10.25675/1021… <list [0]>   <df[,6] … <df[,1… Mountain … #> # … with 15 more rows, and 42 more variables: $container <df[,0]>, #> #   $publicationYear <int>, $subjects <list>, $contributors <list>, #> #   $dates <list>, $language <chr>, $types$ris <chr>, $$bibtex <chr>, #> #   $$citeproc <chr>, $$schemaOrg <chr>, $$resourceType <chr>, #> #   $$resourceTypeGeneral <chr>, $relatedIdentifiers <list>, $sizes <list>, #> #   $formats <list>, $version <lgl>, $rightsList <list>, $descriptions <list>, #> #   $geoLocations <list>, $fundingReferences <list>, $url <chr>, #> #   $contentUrl <lgl>, $metadataVersion <int>, $schemaVersion <chr>, #> #   $source <chr>, $isActive <lgl>, $state <chr>, $reason <lgl>, #> #   $viewCount <int>, $downloadCount <int>, $referenceCount <int>, #> #   $citationCount <int>, $partCount <int>, $partOfCount <int>, #> #   $versionCount <int>, $versionOfCount <int>, $created <chr>, #> #   $registered <chr>, $published <lgl>, $updated <chr>, #> #   relationships$client$data$id <chr>, $$$type <chr> #>  #> $included #> NULL # search within a field dc_dois(query = "publicationYear:2016") # fuzzy search (via *) on a nested field dc_dois(query = "creators.familyName:mil*")

title: Client for the DataCite API
text: Please report issues bugs. License: MIT Get citation information rdatacite R citation(package = 'rdatacite') Please note package released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: DataCite REST API: activities — dc_activities
text: DataCite REST API: activities

title: DataCite REST API: activities — dc_activities
code: dc_activities(   ids = NULL,   query = NULL,   limit = 25,   page = 1,   cursor = NULL,   ... )

title: DataCite REST API: activities — dc_activities
text: ids (character) one activity IDs query (character) Query string limit (numeric/integer) results per page page (numeric/integer) page get results . default: 1 cursor (character) page cursor (used instead limit param). use cursor pagination, set cursor = 1, use link $links$next ... curl options passed crul::verb-GET

title: DataCite REST API: activities — dc_activities
text: info /activities route see https://support.datacite.org/docs/tracking-provenance

title: DataCite REST API: activities — dc_activities
code: if (FALSE) { if (dc_check()) { x <- dc_activities() x # dc_activities(x$data$id[1]) # FIXME: doesn't work, returns no data # dc_activities(query = "ecology") # FIXME: this thlimit a 500 error }}

code: dc_check(...)

title: check if the DataCite API is up or not — dc_check
text: boolean

what: DataCite REST API: client prefixes — dc_client_prefixes

text: DataCite REST API: client prefixes

title: DataCite REST API: client prefixes — dc_client_prefixes
code: dc_client_prefixes(   query = NULL,   year = NULL,   client_id = NULL,   prefix_id = NULL,   sort = NULL,   include = NULL,   limit = 25,   page = 1,   cursor = NULL,   ... )

title: DataCite REST API: client prefixes — dc_client_prefixes
text: query (character) Query string year (integer/numeric/character) year client_id client ID prefix_id prefix ID sort (character) variable sort include (character) vector fields return limit (numeric/integer) results per page page (numeric/integer) page get results . default: 1 cursor (character) page cursor (used instead limit param). use cursor pagination, set cursor = 1, use link $links$next ... curl options passed crul::verb-GET

title: DataCite REST API: client prefixes — dc_client_prefixes
code: if (FALSE) { if (dc_check()) { x <- dc_client_prefixes() x }}

title: DataCite REST API: clients — dc_clients
text: DataCite REST API: clients

title: DataCite REST API: clients — dc_clients
code: dc_clients(   ids = NULL,   query = NULL,   year = NULL,   provider_id = NULL,   software = NULL,   include = NULL,   limit = 25,   page = 1,   cursor = NULL,   ... )

title: DataCite REST API: clients — dc_clients
text: ids (character) one client IDs query (character) Query string year (integer/numeric/character) year provider_id provider ID software idea go , anyone? include (character) vector fields return limit (numeric/integer) results per page page (numeric/integer) page get results . default: 1 cursor (character) page cursor (used instead limit param). use cursor pagination, set cursor = 1, use link $links$next ... curl options passed crul::verb-GET

title: DataCite REST API: clients — dc_clients
code: if (FALSE) { if (dc_check()) { x <- dc_clients() x dc_clients(x$data$id[1]) dc_clients(x$data$id[1:2], verbose = TRUE) }}

title: DataCite content negotation — dc_cn
text: DataCite content negotation

title: DataCite content negotation — dc_cn
code: dc_cn(dois, format = "bibtex", style = "apa", locale = "en-US", ...)

title: DataCite content negotation — dc_cn
text: dois (character) one DOIs format Name format. One "rdf-xml", "turtle", "citeproc-json", "schemaorg", "codemeta", "text", "ris", "bibtex" (default), "datacite-xml", "datacite-json", "bibentry", "jats". style CSL style (text format ). See ‘rcrossref::get_styles()’ options. Default: 'apa'. style DataCite support get (500) Internal Server Error locale Language locale. See ‘?Sys.getlocale’ ... curl options passed crul::verb-GET

title: DataCite content negotation — dc_cn
text: https://support.datacite.org/docs/datacite-content-resolver

title: DataCite REST API: dois — dc_dois
text: DataCite REST API: dois

title: DataCite REST API: dois — dc_dois
code: dc_dois(   ids = NULL,   query = NULL,   created = NULL,   registered = NULL,   provider_id = NULL,   client_id = NULL,   person_id = NULL,   resource_type_id = NULL,   subject = NULL,   schema_version = NULL,   random = NULL,   sample_size = NULL,   sample_group = NULL,   include = NULL,   sort = NULL,   limit = 25,   page = 1,   cursor = NULL,   ... )

title: DataCite REST API: dois — dc_dois
text: ids (character) one DOIs query (character) Query string. See Querying . created (character) metadata year DOI creation created. See Filtering Responses . registered (character) metadata year DOI registration year. See Filtering Responses . provider_id (character) metadata associated specific DataCite provider. See Filtering Responses . client_id (character) metadata associated specific DataCite client. See Filtering Responses . person_id (character) metadata associated specific person's ORCID iD. See Filtering Responses . resource_type_id (character) metadata specific resourceTypeGeneral. See Filtering Responses . subject (character) schema_version (character) metadata schema version deposited metadata schema-version. See Filtering Responses . random (logical) return random set results, can combined kind query. default: FALSE. sample_size (character) sample_group (character) include (character) vector fields return sort (character) variable sort limit (numeric/integer) results per page page (numeric/integer) page get results . default: 1 cursor (character) page cursor (used instead limit param). use cursor pagination, set cursor = 1, use link $links$next ... curl options passed crul::verb-GET

title: DataCite REST API: dois — dc_dois
text: See https://support.datacite.org/docs/api-queries details

title: DataCite REST API: dois — dc_dois
text: See https://support.datacite.org/docs/api-queries#section-filtering-list-responses details

title: DataCite REST API: dois — dc_dois
code: if (FALSE) { if (dc_check()) { x <- dc_dois() x dc_dois(query = "birds") dc_dois(query = "climate change") dc_dois(query = "publicationYear:2016") x <- dc_dois(query = "creators.familyName:mil*", verbose = TRUE) lapply(x$data$attributes$creators, "[[", "familyName") x <- dc_dois(query = "titles.title:climate +change") lapply(x$data$attributes$titles, "[[", "title") dc_dois(client_id = "dryad.dryad") dc_dois(x$data$id[1]) dc_dois(x$data$id[1:3]) dc_dois("10.5281/zenodo.1308060")  # pagination dc_dois(limit = 1) x <- dc_dois(cursor = 1) x$links$`next` }}

title: DataCite REST API: events — dc_events
text: DataCite REST API: events

title: DataCite REST API: events — dc_events
code: dc_events(   ids = NULL,   query = NULL,   subj_id = NULL,   obj_id = NULL,   doi = NULL,   orcid = NULL,   prefix = NULL,   subtype = NULL,   subject = NULL,   source_id = NULL,   registrant_id = NULL,   relation_type_id = NULL,   issn = NULL,   publication_year = NULL,   year_month = NULL,   include = NULL,   sort = NULL,   limit = 25,   page = 1,   cursor = NULL,   ... )

title: DataCite REST API: events — dc_events
text: ids (character) one event IDs query (character) Query event information subj_id (character) identifier event subject, expressed URL. example: https://doi.org/10.7272/q6qn64nk obj_id (character) identifier event object, expressed URL. example: https://doi.org/10.7272/q6qn64nk doi (character) subj-id obj-id event, expressed DOI. example: 10.7272/q6qn64nk orcid (character) ORCID, presumably prefix (character) DOI prefix subj-id obj-id event. example: 10.7272 subtype (character) xxx subject (character) xxx source_id (character) source ID. See Details registrant_id (character) relation_type_id (character) relation-type ID. See Details issn (character) ISSN, presumably publication_year (character) publication year year_month (character) year month event occurred, format YYYY-MM. example 2018-08 include (character) vector fields return sort (character) variable sort limit (numeric/integer) results per page page (numeric/integer) page get results . default: 1 cursor (character) page cursor (used instead limit param). use cursor pagination, set cursor = 1, use link $links$next ... curl options passed crul::verb-GET

title: DataCite REST API: events — dc_events
text: See https://support.datacite.org/docs/eventdata-guide details possible values parameters

title: DataCite REST API: events — dc_events
code: if (FALSE) { if (dc_check()) { # dc_events(query = "birds") }}

title: DataCite REST API: providers — dc_providers
text: ids (character) one provider IDs query (character) query string year (character) year region (character) region name organization_type (character) organization type focus_area (character) focus area include (character) vector fields return limit (numeric/integer) results per page page (numeric/integer) result page, record start cursor (character) page cursor (used instead limit param) ... curl options passed crul::HttpClient

title: DataCite REST API: providers — dc_providers
code: if (FALSE) { if (dc_check()) { x <- dc_providers() x dc_providers(limit = 3) dc_providers(ids = x$data$id[1:5]) }}

title: DataCite REST API: reports — dc_reports
text: DataCite REST API: reports

title: DataCite REST API: reports — dc_reports
code: dc_reports(   ids = NULL,   platform = NULL,   report_name = NULL,   report_id = NULL,   release = NULL,   created = NULL,   created_by = NULL,   include = NULL,   limit = 25,   page = 1,   ... )

title: DataCite REST API: reports — dc_reports
text: ids (character) one report IDs platform (character) Name Platform usage requested . can omitted service provides usage one platform. report_name (character) long name report report_id (character) report ID code shortname. Typically code provided Report parameter request release (character) release version report created (character) Time report prepared. Format defined date-time - RFC3339 created_by (character) Name organization producing report include (character) vector fields return limit (numeric/integer) results per page page (numeric/integer) result page, record start ... curl options passed crul::HttpClient

title: DataCite REST API: reports — dc_reports
code: if (FALSE) { if (dc_check()) { x <- dc_reports() x dc_reports(created = "2019-08-01T07:00:00.000Z") dc_reports(created_by = "urn:node:GOA") dc_reports(limit = 3) # dc_reports(ids = x$reports$id[1:3]) # FIXME: doesn't work }}
